item.title: Adri add a quote by Nancy Mitford
item.description: "I love children, especially when they cry, for then someone takes them away." -- Nancy Mitford

item.title: Adri add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "War is what happens when language fails." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Adri add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "In the spring, at the end of the day, you should smell like dirt." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Adri add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Adri add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "I read for pleasure and that is the moment I learn the most." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Adri add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Adri add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Adri add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Adri add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "There's no limit to how much you'll know, depending how far beyond zebra you go." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Adri add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "My uncle ordered popovers from the restaurant's bill of fare. And, when they were served, he regarded them with a penetrating stare. Then he spoke great words of wisdom as he sat there on that chair: "To eat these things," said my uncle, "You must exercise great care. You may swallow down what's solid, but you must spit out the air!" And as you partake of the world's bill of fare, that's darned good advice to follow. Do a lot of spitting out the hot air. And be careful what you swallow." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Adri add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Adults are just obsolete children and the hell with them." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Adri add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "We waste time looking for the perfect lover, instead of creating the perfect love." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Adri add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "There are many things worth living for, a few things worth dying for, and nothing worth killing for." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Adri add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "If you believe in peace, act peacefully; if you believe in love, acting lovingly; if you believe every which way, then act every which way, that's perfectly valid - but don't go out trying to sell your beliefs to the system. You end up contradicting what you profess to believe in, and you set a bum example. If you want to change the world, change yourself." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Adri add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "A sense of humor...is superior to any religion so far devised." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Adri add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "When we're incomplete, we're always searching for somebody to complete us. When, after a few years or a few months of a relationship, we find that we're still unfulfilled, we blame our partners and take up with somebody more promising. This can go on and on--series polygamy--until we admit that while a partner can add sweet dimensions to our lives, we, each of us, are responsible for our own fulfillment. Nobody else can provide it for us, and to believe otherwise is to delude ourselves dangerously and to program for eventual failure every relationship we enter." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Adri add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "So you think that you're a failure, do you? Well, you probably are. What's wrong with that? In the first place, if you've any sense at all you must have learned by now that we pay just as dearly for our triumphs as we do for our defeats. Go ahead and fail. But fail with wit, fail with grace, fail with style. A mediocre failure is as insufferable as a mediocre success. Embrace failure! Seek it out. Learn to love it. That may be the only way any of us will ever be free." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Adri add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Curiosity, especially intellectual inquisitiveness, is what separates the truly alive from those who are merely going through the motions." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Adri add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "As a child, I was an imaginary playmate." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Adri add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "It's the possibility of having a dream come true that makes life interesting." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Adri add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Life is too short, or too long, for me to allow myself the luxury of living it so badly." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Adri add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Everyone seems to have a clear idea of how other people should lead their lives, but none about his or her own." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Adri add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Don't give in to your fears. If you do, you won't be able to talk to your heart." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Adri add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "In love, no one can harm anyone else; we are each of us responsible for our own feelings and cannot blame someone else for what we feel. It hurt when I lost each of the various men I fell in love with. Now, though, I am convinced that no one loses anyone, because no one owns anyone. That is the true experience of freedom: having the most important thing in the world without owning it." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Adri add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "You are in my blood. I cant help it. We can't be anywhere except together" -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Adri add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow." -- Alice Walker

item.title: Adri add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any." -- Alice Walker

item.title: Adri add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "The animals of the world exist for their own reasons. They were not made for humans any more than black people were made for white, or women created for men." -- Alice Walker

item.title: Adri add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "Helped are those who are content to be themselves; they will never lack mystery in their lives and the joys of self-discovery will be constant." -- Alice Walker

item.title: Adri add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "I have learned not to worry about love; but to honor its coming with all my heart." -- Alice Walker
